result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

RUMS- Refused

1:21 PM Cases 22CF12, 2022CF000069, 2022CF000131, 2022TR000085, 2022TR000117, 2022TR000118, 2022TR000119, 2022TR000120, 2022TR000121, and 2022TR000122 called together.  Defendant, Jacob Jones appears in person with his attorney Daniel Chapman.  James Jay Rennicke appears on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF131 and 22CF69 on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of informations, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Cases proceed to for Plea Hearing.  State provides basis for motions regarding agreement and assures VR compliance.  Court reviews PLQ.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Chapman: def pleading G to felony bond jump (Ct 2) and disorderly conduct (amended Ct 3) in 22CF69; remaining counts DRI, case 22CF131 dismissed outright; request for PSI, parties free to argue.  Court dismisses 22CF131 outright.  State moves to amend Ct 3 of 22CF69 to disorderly conduct; Court grants.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas. Def enters pleas of Guilty.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of Ct 2 and 3 (as amended) of 22CF69 and orders a JOC; 22CF131 is dismissed outright; remaining counts/cases are DRI.  Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing.  Bond continues.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:15 PM Called 22CF12, 22TR85, 22TR117, 22TR118, 22TR119, 22TR120, 22TR121, 22TR122 for STC and 22CF69 and 22CF131 for PH.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob Tyler Jones in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Jacob Tyler Jones. PH's are ready to be WOPH's in both cases.  Cases 22CF69 and 22CF131 both on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearings:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files both information's which mirror the criminal complaints.  Plea negotiations are in progress.  May schedule for ARGN and PLEAS, to be in person.  Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:58 PM Called 22CF12 for PH and 22CF69 scheduled for INIT.  Defendant, Jacob Tyler Jones, appeared with Attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  All parties appear in person.   Case 22CF12 is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Deputy Patrick Carlson, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  State would rest.  Attny Chapman questions the witness, confirms that witness has seen booking photo of the def from the arrest.  No further questions.  No redirect. No further witnesses or argument today.  Deputy steps down.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State efiles information, which mirrors the criminal complaint.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Then 22CF69 set for INIT.   Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Attny Chapman appears especially today.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, handed copy from DA, waives reading. Bond in 22CF12 to cover this case as well.  No objection.  Waive time limits on PH, request to set for STC on same date in May.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
